aprove.Framework.IntTRS.Nonterm.GeoNonTerm

Class GeoNonTermAnalysis

  • java.lang.Object
    • aprove.Framework.IntTRS.Nonterm.GeoNonTerm.GeoNonTermAnalysis

  • public class GeoNonTermAnalysis
extends java.lang.Object
    The main class of the geometric non-termination analysis presented by Jan Leike and Matthias Heizmann. (Source: https://monteverdi.informatik.uni-freiburg.de/tomcat/Website/?ui=tool&tool=lasso_ranker)

    This class generates the STEM X and LOOP parts of a given IRSwTProblem, derives a speed matrix J as a column vector of generalized eigenvalues and a direction matrix Y.
    After the derivation of the iteration matrix A and constants b, so that A*(x x') <= b , the method uses a SMTSolver to derive a so called Geometric Non-Termination Argument.
    Author:
    Timo Bergerbusch *

      • getRuleAsArray

        private aprove.Framework.BasicStructures.FunctionSymbol[] getRuleAsArray(aprove.DPFramework.IDPProblem.IGeneralizedRule rule)
        This method takes in a rule and returns the variables that are mentioned in the right side of the rule. Therefore it does not hold for rule's that have different var's within a rule.
        Parameters:
        rule - the rule to extract the variables from
        Returns:
        the extracted variables

      • deriveLOOP

        private void deriveLOOP()
        computes the Loop by computing the updateMatrix and updateConstants of the Loop using deriveUpdatePart(TRSTerm, TRSTerm) and afterwards computing the guardMatrix with corresponding guardConstants using deriveGuardPart(IGeneralizedRule).
        See Also:
        deriveUpdatePart(TRSTerm, TRSTerm), deriveGuardPart(IGeneralizedRule), Loop

      • deriveUpdatePart

        private void deriveUpdatePart(aprove.DPFramework.BasicStructures.TRSTerm leftSide,
                              aprove.DPFramework.BasicStructures.TRSTerm rightSide)
        This method derives the update matrix and constants to a given rule, by parsing it into a RPNTree using RPNTreeParser.parseSetToTree(TRSTerm). Note: it gets left and right instead of the rule itself, because they are already computed anyway.
        Parameters:
        leftSide - the left side the rule
        rightSide - the right side of the rule.

      • deriveGuardPart

        private void deriveGuardPart(aprove.DPFramework.IDPProblem.IGeneralizedRule rule)
        This method derives the guard matrix and constants of a given rule, by parsing only the condition terms into a RPNTree after splitting them into the different rules.
        So it splits: x_1 > 0 && x_3 > 5
        Into the two conditions and parses them separately.
        Parameters:
        rule - the rule containing the conditions

      • tryDerivingAGNA

        private GeoNonTermArgument tryDerivingAGNA()
        This method try's to derive a GeoNonTermArgument using a SMT-Solver.
        It can only do so if before the Stem and Loop including Loop.computeIterationMatrixAndConstants() are computed. Otherwise it's most likely to throw a NullPointerException.
        If a GeoNonTermArgument can be found it will be returned. Otherwise this method will return null.
        Returns:
        a GeoNonTermArgument or null
        See Also:
        Stem, Loop, SMTFactory

      • createYFromModel

        private GNAVector[] createYFromModel(aprove.Framework.SMT.Solver.SMTLIB.Model model,
                                     char last)
        This method computes from a given Model the different GNAVector as columns of the Y-matrix of the GeoNonTermAnalysis. It does so by creating a vector for every char between 'a' and the given last used char. The char for example 'a' is afterwards used and gets indices to a max., which is the result of countAppearance(Model, String) and computes the value using getValueOfVariableWithinModel(Model, String). The declarations within the model get sorted by the index. 
         [(define-fun x0 2), (define-fun b1 2), (define-fun b0 14), (define-fun a1 0), (define-fun a0 8), (define-fun s1 2), (define-fun s0 22)]
         8   14
 => [(0),( 2)]
        Parameters:
        model - the model of the SMT-Problem
        last - the last char used
        Returns:
        an array of GNAVectors to represent the variable assignment

      • createMuFromModel

        private int[] createMuFromModel(aprove.Framework.SMT.Solver.SMTLIB.Model m)
        This method computes from a given Model the mu's assignments so that the ray criteria is fulfilled. It derives the assignments of the mu's ordered chronologically by the index using countAppearance(Model, String) and getValueOfVariableWithinModel(Model, String).
        Beispiel: 
         [(define-fun X0 2), (define-fun b1 2), (define-fun b0 14), (define-fun a1 0), (define-fun a0 8), (define-fun s1 2), (define-fun s0 22)]
 => [2]
        The mu's are written as capital X so that the other variables can contain the lower capital letter 'x' .
        Parameters:
        m - the model of the SMT-Problem
        Returns:
        an int-array with the values of the mu's

      • getValueOfVariableWithinModel

        private int getValueOfVariableWithinModel(aprove.Framework.SMT.Solver.SMTLIB.Model m,
                                          java.lang.String varName)
        This method takes a Model and the name of a desired values variable and computes it's assignment within the model using Model.get(Symbol) and parsing into int.
        Parameters:
        m - the model of the SMT-Problem
        varName - the name of the variable (with index)
        Returns:
        the assigned value of the variable

      • countAppearance

        private int countAppearance(aprove.Framework.SMT.Solver.SMTLIB.Model m,
                            java.lang.String varName)
        This method iterates through the given model and count's the appearances of the given name.
        NOTE: if the variables would be "aa" and "ab" would be a problem.
        Parameters:
        m - the model of the SMT-Problem
        varName - the name of the variable (without index)
        Returns:
        the number of appearances of the variable

                             aprove.Framework.BasicStructures.FunctionSymbol fs)
        looks up the index of a IGeneralizedRule in an array that starts with the given FunctionSymbol
        Parameters:
        rules - the array of IGeneralizedRule's
        fs - the query FunctionSymbol
        Returns:
        den index ( -1 if isn't contained)
